video_caption: The video begins with a black screen that transitions to a stunning view of Saturn, showcasing its iconic rings against a backdrop of stars and a radiant light source. The video features a presentation slide titled "FIGURE 18.4" from OpenStax, detailing the revolution of a binary star system. The diagram shows the positions of the stars over time, with arrows indicating their movement. The text below the diagram explains that the observations were taken from the ground and that an international team of astronomers used these observations to directly measure the mass of the brown dwarf, which is 8.6% of the mass of our sun. The slide also mentions the involvement of ESA/ESO and the Max-Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics in Germany.
